Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Camille L. Velez-Rive: Initial Appearance as to Jose A. Ortiz-Torres, Angel L. Santos-Berrios, Adalberto Vega- Vazquez, Chrstian Cartagena-Cruz, Omar Rodriguez, Eliezer Rosado-Rivera, Ariel Lopez-Colon, Jose O. Lopez-Melendez, Alexis Garcia-Ocasio, Christian Cotto-Lopez, Christian Rodriguez-Suarez, Jose A. Morales-Acosta, Aixa D. Leon-Melendez held on 10/16/. Present were AUSA Olga Castello and USPTO Carolina Aparicio. Defendants were provided with copy of the indictment and advised as to the charges and their rights. After verifying the CJA-23 forms filled by defendants, the Court ordered that CJA Panel members be appointed to represent them. Arraignment/Detention set for 10/19/2012 at 02:00 PM in Courtroom 11 before US Magistrate Judge Camille L. Velez-Rive. Defendants are ordered detained pending hearings. (yr) (Entered: 10/17/2012)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Camille L. Velez-Rive: Arraignment/Detention as to Aixa D. Leon-Melendez (40) Count 1,2,3,4,5 held on 10/19/2012. Present: AUSA Olga Castellon and defense counsel Irma R. Valldejuli. Defendant present U/C and assisted by the court interpreter. Defendant was found competent to understand the proceedings. She waived the reading of the Indictment and entered a plea of not guilty as to all counts charged. The parties will have 7 days for discovery and 14 days thereafter to file any motions. Case is referred to Judge Jay A. Garcia Gregory for trial setting. As to bail, defense counsel argued in favor of bail. Government moved for detention. After hearing the arguments of the parties, the Court adopted PTS Report, bail set in the amount of $10,000.00 of which $5,000.00 shall be cash or secured the remaining balance unsecured with signature. Conditions of release as recommended by PTS, to include drug test and or treatment; find another location to reside outside Brisas de Cayey Public Housing, Toita Ward or Buena Vista Ward. Defendant must stay away from housing projects mentioned in the indictment. (Court Reporter FTR.) Hearing set for 02:00. Hearing held at 03:45. Hearing ended at 04:00. Interpreter Edna Brayfield. (amr) (Entered: 10/22/2012)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Bruce J. McGiverin: Arraignment/Detention Hearing as to Jose Alvelo-Galvan (27) was held on 10/25/2012. Present: AUSA Teresa Zapata, Atty Ismael Rodriguez, PO Nancy Mendez, Interpreter Janis Palma and Deft. Deft's correct name is Joel Alvelo-Galvan. Deft was found competent to understand the proceedings. He waived the reading of the Indictment and entered a plea of not guilty as to all applicable counts. The parties will have 7 days for discovery and 14 days thereafter to file any motions. Case is referred to Judge Garcia-Gregory for trial setting. The govt moved for detention. Defense counsel was heard as to bail. Bail is set in the amount of $10,000.00 of which $5,000.00 shall be secured by cash or real property and the remaining balance shall be unsecured. Bonding Co. will be allowed. Standard conditions of release to include home detention with electronic monitoring and drug testing/drug treatment. Deft shall not reside at or visit, for any reason, the Brisas de Cayey Public Housing Project. Release order to issue once secured portion has been posted and PTS has verified that a landline telephone has been installed within deft's residence. (Court Reporter FTR) (Hearing was set for 9:00 a.m., held at 9:43-9:52 a.m.) (mc) Modified on 11/1/2012 to correct deft's T/N(ab). (Entered: 10/29/2012)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Silvia Carreno-Coll: Arraignment/Bail as to Giovanni Lopez-Garcia (6) Count 1,2,3,4,5,6 held on 1/16/2013. AUSA Teresa Zapata and defense counsel Robert Millan were present. As to Arraignment, the Court finds defendant competent at this time. Defendant waived the reading of the Indictment. Plea of Not Guilty is entered. Defense is granted seven (7) days to obtain discovery and fourteen (14) days thereafter to file all motions. The case is referred to the Judge for trial setting thereafter. As to Bail, the Government was heard by proffer and moved for detention. Defense counsel proffered that defendant, although on probation, was gainfully employed and request that bond be set. After hearing the parties, the Court ordered defendant detained without bail pending trial. (Court Reporter FTR/bg.) Hearing set for 09:00. Hearing held at 10:29. Hearing ended at 10:34. Interpreter Annie Flores. (br) (Entered: 01/17/2013)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Camille L. Velez-Rive:Change of Plea Hearing as to Angel Ramon Santos-Berrios held on 8/14/2013. Present were AUSA Teresa Zapata and Ms. Rachel Brill. Dft is present and on bond. Waiver of JT and consent to proceed before a U. S. Magistrate Judge was filed and accepted in open court. The defendant is found competent to understand the proceedings. He is advised of the maximum penalties he's facing, his constitutional rights, consequences of waiving said rights and the applicable statutory guidelines. After hearing the parties, the Magistrate Judge will issue a Report and Recommendation to Judge Garcia so that the guilty plea as to count One (1) of the Indictment be accepted. The Court orders the preparation of the Pre-Sentence Report. Sentencing Hearing to be set by Judge Garcia. Defendant to remain under the same conditions of release. Ms. Brill requested that defendant be allowed today to take a couple of hours extra in order to solve a problem with the bank before arriving to his home in Cayey. The Court granted the request. Ms. Brill also requested that defendant be allowed to accompany his father on Saturdays to little league baseball clinics. The Court also granted the request as long as there is prior notification to Probation and that he's accompanied by his father. (E-mail to USPO) (Court Reporter -FTR.)Hearing set for 09:00.Hearing held at 09:50.Hearing ended at 10:14.Interpreter -Sonia Crescioni. (yr) (Entered: 08/15/2013)

Rivera-Ortega (15) held on 7/18/2014, re: 1159 MOTION to Withdraw as Attorney and for Appointment of New CJA Counsel. AUSA Teresa Zapata and defense counsel Thomas Lincoln were present. Defense counsel expressed as to the efforts made during the plea negotiations process and the purpose of filing the motion to withdraw. The Government informed that counsel had been diligent during the plea negotiations and clarified that it is one plea agreement that had been modified in two or three occasions. Defendant would be pleading to Count One (1) and not Count Six (6) and would be Type C plea. The Court addressed defendant during a colloquy. After listening to the parties, the Court finds that counsel is doing everything in his power to represent defendant diligently and that the offer received is a good one. Minute Entry for proceedings held before Judge Jay A. Garcia-Gregory: Sentencing held on 9/6/2016 for Pedro A. Pedraza-Negron (30). AUSA Teresa Zapata and defense counsel Ovidio Zayas were present. Defendant was present, on bond and assisted by a certified court interpreter. The Government recommends that the Court impose a sentence at the lower end of the guidelines. No objections to the PSI Report. Statements in support of mitigation of punishment heard on behalf of the defense. Defendant's allocution was heard. Sentence imposed as to Count(s) 1, Impr Term: 37 months, SRT: 6 years, SMA: $100.00. By request of the Government, Count(s) 2, 3, 4, 5, are Dismissed. All terms and conditions are specified in the judgment form. The defendant was advised of his right to appeal. (USPO Brenda Davila.) (Court Reporter Cindy Brown.) Hearing set for 02:30. Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Bruce J. McGiverin: Preliminary Revocation and Detention Hearing as to Joel Arvelo-Galban (27) held on 11/30/2017. Present: AUSA George Massucco, AFPD Edwin Mora, USPO Luis Santana. Defendant was U/C, present in court and assisted by a certified court interpreter. Counsel for defendant informed that they are waiving the hearing. Waiver of Preliminary Hearing was filed. The Court approved the same and made a finding of probable cause. Case is referred to Judge Jay A. Garcia-Gregory for setting of Final Revocation Hearing. As to detention, defense counsel argued in favor of bail pending final revocation hearing. No opposition from the government if defendant is released directly to a treatment center. After hearing the parties, the Court granted defendant's request and ordered that the defendant be released to Guarabi for treatment pending final revocation hearing. USPO to coordinate. (Court Reporter DCR.)Hearing set for 09:30.Hearing held at 10:06.Hearing ended at 10:09. Interpreter Olga Uribe. (dv) (Entered: 11/30/2017)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before Judge Jay A. Garcia-Gregory:Final Hearing re Revocation of Supervised Release as to Alexis Garcia-Ocasio (23) held on 4/27/2018. . AUSA Teresa Zapata, AFPD Laura Soto and USPO Luz Enid Aponte were present. Defendant was present, on bond and assisted by a certified court interpreter. Allegations were not contested.  Statements in support of mitigation of punishment heard on behalf of the defense. The Court finds that defendant violated the conditions of the imposed supervised release term. Therefore, the terms of supervised release imposed in this case was revoked. It is the judgment of the Court, that defendant is hereby committed to the custody of the US BOP for a term of 30 days, followed by halfway house as suggested by US Probation Office with outpatient substance abuse treatment and compliance with all rules of the halfway house as well as the initial conditions of supervised imposed at the original sentence. SRT of 60 months. The defendant was advised of his right to appeal(Court Reporter Diane Breaz.)Hearing set for 03:00.Hearing held at 04:21.Hearing ended at 04:51.Interpreter Edna Brayfield. Martinez- Vicente (17).Present were AUSA Pedro Casablanca for Teresa Zapata, AFPD Defense Counsel Emilio Morris and USPO Carmen Villeta. Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Bruce J. McGiverin:Preliminary Revocation Hearing re 1801 , 1797 , 1748 as to Luis Alexander Rodriguez-Rodriguez (18), and re 1800 , 1783 , 1746 as to Andy Pierce-De-Jesus (29) held on 4/25/2019. Present: AUSA Teresa Zapata, AFPD Eleonora Marranzini, Attorney Marta Rey, USPO Jose Lozada, and USPO Alexandria Oliveras. Both defendants were present, under custody and assisted by a certified court interpreter. Both defendants filed Waiver of Preliminary Hearing Forms which were approved by the Court. As to both defendants, the Court found probable cause pursuant to Rule 5 and 32.1 of the Fed.R.Crim.P. in regard to the association allegation. As to Defendant #18, the Court also found probable cause as to the drug use allegation. These matters were referred to U.S. District Judge Jay A. Garcia-Gregory for Final Revocation Hearing. The allegations related to the charges at state level as to both defendants were withdrawn by the Government since the case was dismissed. Upon agreement by the parties, the Court ordered both defendants released under the same conditions of supervision they are currently under and in addition, curfew with electronic monitoring. Curfew to be set by the USPO. Final Revocation Hearing to be set by the Presiding Judge. (Court Reporter DCR-Courtroom 9.)Hearing set for 09:00.Hearing held at 09:52.Hearing ended at 09:57. Interpreter Olga Uribe. (lod) (Entered: 04/25/2019)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Marcos E. Lopez: Preliminary Revocation Hearing as to Andy Pierce-De-Jesus (29) held on 9/30/2019. AUSA Teresa Zapata, AFPD Eleonora Marranzini and USPO Alexandria Oliveras were present. Defendant was present in court, under custody and assisted by the certified court interpreter. The government called USPO Alexandria Oliveras to the witness stand and sworn testimony was heard. Direct and cross examination was conducted. The government called PRPD Arnaldo Luna-Burgos to the witness stand and sworn testimony was heard. Direct and cross examination was conducted. Government exhibits 2, 3, 4, 5, 6 and 7 were presented and admitted into evidence. Government exhibits 2, 3, 6 and 7 were admitted contingent upon a certified translation being submitted within 5 days. Defense exhibits A, A-1 and A-2 were presented and admitted into evidence. After having heard the witnesses and the parties, the Court found probable cause as to all the allegations at ECF Nos. 1828 and 1849 , except for the alleged violation of P.R.'s domestic violence statue regarding statutory condition No. 1. The case was referred to Judge Jay A. Garcia Gregory for the scheduling of a Final Revocation Hearing. (Court Reporter DCR / Courtroom 10.) Hearing set for 09:30. Hearing held at 10:19. Hearing ended at 01:17. Interpreter Olga Uribe. (jjr) (Entered: 10/03/2019)

The Court a approved the defendant's oral waiver and found probable cause as to the violations informed in 1886 Motion Notifying Violations to Supervised Release Term with the exception of the mandatory condition regarding the state crime. As to detention, defense counsel stated that at this time they had nothing to offer but they reserve the right to request a reopening of the matter should new information arise. (Court Reporter ZOOM.) Hearing set for 9:30 AM. Hearing held at 9:35 AM. Hearing ended at 9:42 AM. Interpreter Ani Navarro. (cmd) (Entered: 02/04/2021)
